content: faudrait-il résister? et d'abord à l'analyse? must analyze this “il faut”
linkedContent: faudrait-il résister? et d'abord à l'analyse? must analyze this “il faut”

content: Derrida loves French word résistance, loaded w/ pathos of his nostalgia, dreams of bombing in the ‘40s > secret of inconsolable nostalgia resists analysis, kinda like navel of dream

content: Derrida turns “je suis” into “I follow (je suis)” > I hunt, chase after the animal

linkedContent: Giusti: for Aristotle, art of dialectic is the exercise of dialogue w/ tradition [?]

content: a meaning that exceeds but doesn’t resist analysis: Freud’s verborgene Sinn
linkedContent: a meaning that exceeds but doesn’t resist analysis: Freud’s verborgene Sinn

content: if the verborgene Sinn (hidden sense) (of dream), omphalos, is homogenous to order of analyzable > psychoanalytic reason as hermeneutic
linkedContent: if the verborgene Sinn (hidden sense) (of dream), omphalos, is homogenous to order of analyzable > psychoanalytic reason as hermeneutic

content: [here] analytic concern merges w/ hermeneutic drive, w/ principle of reason (reddere rationem): render sense at all cost (à tout prix), il faut rendre: fidelity, debt, duty, to restitute sense of sense > even if hidden, verborgene Sinn

content: [everyone has analyzed “Dream of Irma’s Injection,” so, modest Derrida, will add nothing, only differance, the something other than sense itself in the interpretation]
linkedContent: [everyone has analyzed “Dream of Irma’s Injection,” so, modest Derrida, will add nothing, only differance, the something other than sense itself in the interpretation]

content: Freud says he’s responsible for the Lösung (analysis, solution, medication) but not the resistance of the patient, patient alone is responsible for his/her resistance
linkedContent: Freud says he’s responsible for the Lösung (analysis, solution, medication) but not the resistance of the patient, patient alone is responsible for his/her resistance

content: sträuben (to stand on end, to resist), recalcitrant to treatment
linkedContent: sträuben (to stand on end, to resist), recalcitrant to treatment

content: Derrida proposes an other resistance, that of the remainder, thus a restanalysis
linkedContent: Derrida proposes an other resistance, that of the remainder, thus a restanalysis

content: the poleros (politics, polemos, eros, seduction) of analysis, ends in an abyss, where resistance to psychoanalytic Lösung, in the name of truth, can only be a disavowal > to analyze, to say to other: prefer, take, love my solution, you will be in truth if you do not resist my solution

content: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel

content: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien

content: how can the cut be the tie itself? how can the link be the interruption?
linkedContent: how can the cut be the tie itself? how can the link be the interruption?

content: acc. Foucault, that which has already been mastered can no longer be mastered
linkedContent: acc. Foucault, that which has already been mastered can no longer be mastered

content: “one must” as Factum or Fatum (prevents us w/out prohibiting us from going beyond), or “one must” as duty (prohibits going beyond, leaves presumption of sense undecided)

content: in Freud, weaves, knots that can’t be untangled, Geflecht (Heidegger), challenges notion of analysis as unknotting; knowing how to pull on threads, Plato’s Statesman, diaresis, the royal art (technē) of the weaver; in Goethe, “fabrication of thought”—a thousand links in one stroke (Schlag)

content: violence of psychoanalysis, actively counters forces of resistance
linkedContent: violence of psychoanalysis, actively counters forces of resistance

content: is resistance (Widerstände) to analysis something that later one can interpret (Enlightenment logic, progressivism), or is it an unanalyzable darkness (fatalistic pessimism), or is it heterogenous to interpretation [resistance as the very wish of a dream]

linkedContent: psychoanalysis is in principle nonhypnotic, affirms right to resistance to hypnosis (and said resistance’s insurmountability)

content: violence of psychoanalysis: turn resister into “collaborator” (Freud’s words), or then deprive patient’s defenses of all value
linkedContent: violence of psychoanalysis: turn resister into “collaborator” (Freud’s words), or then deprive patient’s defenses of all value

content: it is thus the trace that resists analysis
linkedContent: it is thus the trace that resists analysis

content: was not Freud looking for, in “death drive,” in “repetition compulsion,” the principle before the principle (of pleasure/reality), l’esprit de cette spirale, voilà qui tient en haleine [holds one in suspense], ou si vous aimez mieux: en vie

content: qui, fors Dieu, a jamais créé, ce qui s’appelle créé, un concept?
linkedContent: qui, fors Dieu, a jamais créé, ce qui s’appelle créé, un concept?

content: Freud’s link to all disciplines that question analysis: teaching, teaching philosophy, and (w/ its concern for truth & avowal) confession
linkedContent: Freud’s link to all disciplines that question analysis: teaching, teaching philosophy, and (w/ its concern for truth & avowal) confession

linkedContent: royal weaver (le tisserand royal) of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort

content: as such, Freud’s discourse answerable to logico-epistemological tribunal of analytic tradition
linkedContent: as such, Freud’s discourse answerable to logico-epistemological tribunal of analytic tradition

content: history of analysis, from Plato to Freud, has Freud invented a new solution to analytical resistance or has he inherited by way of paleonym?; no choice but to keep 2 motifs analysis, doubling of analuein: 1) archeological/anagogical movement toward originary birth 2) eschatological movement toward last word, toward untying, breaking down (lytic, lytological, philolytic) [analysis in teaching (philosophy), in confession]

content: acc. Foucault, Doctor attains power through credit given to fiction, secrecy effect [Derrida shows how, in this case, Foucault places Evil Genius on the side of reason/order/father]

linkedContent: if there is not one resistance to psychoanalysis, then there is no “la psychanalyse” > more than one psychoanalysis, resistance, for noncontingent, nonaccidental reasons

content: Freud’s 5 resistances in “Inhibition, Symptom, Anxiety,” one of which is the ego benefiting from the illness > Derrida finds such behavior so commonplace, he wonders by what confused concept of illness this could be an interesting singularity

linkedContent: paralysis gives movement w/ regard to its other [this is in reference to impossibility of psychoanalysis’ auto-interpretation] (in PAS, paralysis distinguished from logic of analysis)

content: inability to identify w/ oneself, unify oneself, gather oneself > alliance of destiny, namely tragedy, and chance as the possible or aleatory [no pertinence to dramatization]
linkedContent: inability to identify w/ oneself, unify oneself, gather oneself > alliance of destiny, namely tragedy, and chance as the possible or aleatory [no pertinence to dramatization]

content: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining ——double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis

linkedContent: double “one must” is against philosophy of life, against desire for decontamination, where pure life = pure death

content: the arbitrary 8 motifs [pour faire penser à l'institution de l'infini debout] Derrida finds deconstructible in Lacan: 1) proper, circular return to place of lack 2) truth as adequation 3) “full speech” 4) the mechanical archive as “alienating” 5) transcendental phallus 6) phonocentrism 7) failure to account for literary structure of narration 8) a “spiriting away” of double in Poe, which would have brought symbolic and imaginary closer together, thus blurred tripartite as well
